name: Deathweaver
description: The Deathweaver is a huge monstrosity with a fearsome appearance, capable of climbing surfaces easily and utilizing its webs to ensnare foes. Its body is associated with necrotic energies, enhancing its dark capabilities.
memorable: Its ability to create web zombies from slain foes makes the Deathweaver a terrifying opponent, capable of building an army during combat.
goals: To ambush and ensnare adventurers, utilizing traps and necrotic magic to weaken foes and control the battlefield.
relations: Typically related to other web-based creatures and undead, like spiders and zombies.
environment: Often found in dark, web-laden areas such as caves or ruins.
strengths: Blindsight allows it to detect creatures in the dark, while its web sense gives it unparalleled awareness in web-filled environments.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to fire damage, which can destroy its webbing and damage it significantly.
attacks: The Deathweaver can execute swift and deadly bite attacks alongside the ability to ensnare enemies in magical webs.
most_powerful_ability: Vampiric Touch allows it to heal itself while damaging an opponent, making it a formidable foe in prolonged encounters.
senses: Possesses blindsight up to 20 feet, enabling it to detect creatures without relying on sight.
skills: Has high proficiency in stealth, enabling effective ambush tactics, and decent perception for awareness.
additional_information: Can create zones of Darkness to hinder enemy visibility.
Utilizes webbing to restrain and damage opponents each turn.
Can create undying minions if foes are killed by its webs.
spellcasting: Innate spellcasting allows it to cast necrotic-related spells like Chill Touch, Darkness, and Vampiric Touch without physical components.
test_queries: huge monster that creates web zombies
monster that uses webs and necrotic magic
ambush creature with powerful bite attacks
dark creature that climbs and traps enemies
malevolent creature with blindsight and web sense
